Actions (30 min) : choix dâ€™une action individuelle et une action collective pour tendre vers une alimentation plus durable et anticipation des difficultÃ©s/freins qui pourraient Ãªtre rencontrÃ©s
DÃ©brief (15 min) : retours sur lâ€™atelier, derniers conseils, quelle suite donner Ã  lâ€™atelier, ...

title: Construction Collage online with Ash
description:
10.00 - 13.30 London time 
  Construction Collage is a participatory workshop that breaks down how the construction and built environment industry contributes to the climate crisis.
During the workshop, you will :
In a small group, play out 45 game cards on the themes of urban planning, design, construction, and use of resources.
Find the cause and effect links between the different components of the industry by positioning and linking the cards.
Form a mind map to understand the big picture of the environmental and social issues of the construction industry.
Propose and discuss solutions.
  Duration
3h30. The time flies by, so please arrive 5 minutes early, we start sharp.
Who is it for?
Everyone is concerned by climate change and biodiversity loss. Construction Collage was therefore designed for people with an interest in the construction sector, as well as for all construction professionals: the former will discover the subject and deconstruct their prejudices, while the latter will go deeper and question their practices.
Make sure you have good internet connection and a laptop or a desktop to play from,  tablettes and phones will not work. A link for the event will be sent to you closer to the date.

title: Atelier Ã  Munich, en allemand
full_location: Kulturzentrum Giesinger Bahnhof, Giesinger Bahnhofplatz, Munich, Allemagne
description:
What does it mean exactly to respect the Paris Agreement? All the countries that signed it commited to limit the rise in mean global temperature to +2 Â°C so that our planet remains habitable. To do that, we need to follow the carbon budgets defined by the IPCC : it's a time race against our greenhouse gas. emissions THIS is what we call "climate emergency".
If you want to act swiftly and efficiently, you need some key numbers and facts. Our workshop gives clear information : simple, fact-based imagery to picture yourself in a viable future where you can live happily while dealing with what's at stake. Based on scientific data, our workshop gives room to debate around what prevents us from acting and how to overcome those obstacles (emotions, expectations, prejudices...).
What's more, our facilitators will discuss solutions they have themselves tried and approved, they will inspire you to join the movement and get into action (if you're not already)! 

The workshop will be in German
